etymology.description: semantic: 口 ‘mouth; speech’ + phonetic: 剌 (là).
etymology.interpretation: Combines the mouth radical to signal sound/speech with the phonetic 剌 to suggest the lǎ/là pronunciation. It came to refer to blaring or noisy sounds and is now common in words like 喇叭 (horn) and the transliteration 喇嘛 (lama).

examples.chinese: 别在走廊里吹喇叭(別在走廊裡吹喇叭)。
examples.pinyin: Bié zài zǒuláng lǐ chuī lǎba.
examples.english: Don’t blow the horn in the hallway.

examples.chinese: 寺院里有喇嘛诵经(寺院裡有喇嘛誦經)。
examples.english: There are lamas chanting scriptures in the temple.

examples.chinese: 孩子们拿着喇叭在街上吵闹(孩子們拿著喇叭在街上吵鬧)。
examples.pinyin: Háizimen názhe lǎba zài jiē shàng chǎonào.
examples.english: The kids are making a racket on the street with their horns.
